KnowledgeBase.Title: Example String stringCiGT 001
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive greater

Example.Description: These examples use the stringCiGT function to see if the first String is greater than the second String. The Boolean value, true or false is returned. In these examples, a case-insensitive comparison is done with the Strings.

Syntax.Note: The ASCII numeric code for "H" is greater than the ASCII numeric code for "G".
The ASCII numeric code for "W" is greater than the ASCII numeric code for the whitespace character.
